TopicTitle: LC Explorer Mk I - Test mission to Minmus

Articles.Content:
I spent somewhere around an hour or two designing a new ship, and thought, "why not do a detailed mission report of its maiden flight?" I've always wanted to put up a full mission on the forums, and I've never gotten around to it. So here it is. This is the Light Celestial Explorer Mk I probe, on its journey from Kerbin to Minmus for its maiden flight. For not having tested any part of it, I was certainly more than pleased with the result of the mission. Let me know what you guys think!

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited October 11, 2013 by tstehler1
Well done and congratulations on landing successfully. My only queries is why there was so much fuel needed. I could do that with half of the rocket mass. Did you have spare fuel?
Nifty probe. So, that's a lot of rocket under it and this was a test. Where are you really planning to send it?

Both of you are correct, this thing had a lot more fuel than was necessary, especially when dealing with a planet with such low gravity as Minmus (it takes basically no effort, engine-wise, to land there). Yes, there was an enormous amount of spare fuel. I'd like to send it to Ike or Gilly, as I've never landed on either before.
